penetration.translation[0].definitions[0: when something or someone enters or passes through something, especially when this is difficult
Cover the entire device to prevent water penetration.
The attack failed to lead to any deep penetration of enemy territory.
penetration.translation[0].definitions[1: the degree to which a product is available or sold in an area
the rise in import penetration of the domestic market
penetration.translation[0].definitions[2: when a system of beliefs enters a society and becomes accepted
the penetration of Marxism into Latin America
penetration.translation[0].definitions[3: when someone joins and gets accepted by an organization, business etc in order to find out secret information
foreign penetration of the British secret service
penetration.translation[0].definitions[4: when a man puts his penis into a woman’s vagina or into someone’s anus
penetration.translation[0].definitions[5: a special ability to understand things very clearly and completely
penetration.translation[1].definitions[0: when a product starts to be sold in a new area or to a new group of people
our successful penetration of overseas oil markets
penetration.translation[1].definitions[1: how much of a particular market one company’s sales or one product’s sales cover. This can be shown as a percentage of the possible sales in that market
